name.fi: Data Science for Business I D, Luento-opetus
name.en: Data Science for Business I D, Lecture

workload.fi: Lectures, tutorials, assignments, course project
workload.sv: Lectures, tutorials, assignments, course project
workload.en: Lectures, tutorials, assignments, course project

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Prior knowledge in programming is recommended. Working knowledge of statistics and linear algebra is also required. The students are also assumed to know the fundamentals of multivariate calculus (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Prior knowledge in programming is recommended. Working knowledge of statistics and linear algebra is also required. The students are also assumed to know the fundamentals of multivariate calculus (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Prior knowledge in programming is recommended. Working knowledge of statistics and linear algebra is also required. The students are also assumed to know the fundamentals of multivariate calculus (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).

learningOutcomes.fi:
The objective of the course is to provide an introduction to practical data science from the perspective of business
analysts. Part of the course material touches also more advanced topics to provide further content for the students that are interested in knowing more about the underlying theory and techical aspects. After completing the course, students will understand the basic principles of predictive modeling and gain experience in using machine learning models to solve business problems.
learningOutcomes.sv:
The objective of the course is to provide an introduction to practical data science from the perspective of business
analysts. Part of the course material touches also more advanced topics to provide further content for the students that are interested in knowing more about the underlying theory and techical aspects. After completing the course, students will understand the basic principles of predictive modeling and gain experience in using machine learning models to solve business problems.
learningOutcomes.en:
The objective of the course is to provide an introduction to practical data science from the perspective of businessanalysts. Part of the course material touches also more advanced topics to provide further content for the students that are interested in knowing more about the underlying theory and techical aspects.
After completing the course, students will understand the basic principles of predictive modeling and gain experience in using machine learning models to solve business problems.

content.fi:
Topics covered include basics of predictive modeling, classification, variable selection, hyperparameter tuning, ensemble learning, evaluation of models, problem of overfitting and its avoidance.
The course has a strong focus on empirical assignments, which require prior knowledge in statistics and basic skills in programming/scripting (or at least willingness to learn).
content.sv:

The course has a strong focus on empirical assignments, which require prior knowledge in statistics and basic skills in programming/scripting (or at least willingness to learn).
content.en:
Topics covered include basics of predictive modeling, classification, variable selection, hyperparameter tuning, ensemble learning, evaluation of models, problem of overfitting and its avoidance.
The course has a strong focus on empirical assignments, which require prior knowledge in statistics and basic skills in programming/scripting (or at least willingness to learn).

After completing the course, students will understand the basic principles of predictive modeling and gain experience in using machine learning models to solve business problems.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The objective of the course is to provide an introduction to practical data science from the perspective of business
analysts. Part of the course material touches also more advanced topics to provide further content for the students that are interested in knowing more about the underlying theory and techical aspects. After completing the course, students will understand the basic principles of predictive modeling and gain experience in using machine learning models to solve business problems.

organizationName.en: Department of Information and Service Management

name.fi: Capstone: Data Science for Business II D, Luento-opetus
name.en: Capstone: Data Science for Business II D, Lecture

workload.fi: Lectures, tutorials, assignments
workload.sv: Lectures, tutorials, assignments
workload.en: Lectures, tutorials, assignments

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Data Science for Business I; Business Analytics 1 or 2 or equivalent skills. Intermediate / advanced skills in Python or R programming. Intermediate understanding of multivariate calculus is assumed (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Data Science for Business I; Business Analytics 1 or 2 or equivalent skills. Intermediate / advanced skills in Python or R programming. Intermediate understanding of multivariate calculus is assumed (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Data Science for Business I; Business Analytics 1 or 2 or equivalent skills. Intermediate / advanced skills in Python or R programming. Intermediate understanding of multivariate calculus is assumed (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).

learningOutcomes.fi: The course introduces modern methods in predictive modelling (e.g. quantile/convex regression and deep learning) and provides an introduction to Explanable Artificial Intelligence (xAI) and Interpretable Machine Learning (IML). Upon completion of the course, students will be able to apply machine learning techniques to support business decision making.
learningOutcomes.sv: The course introduces modern methods in predictive modelling (e.g. quantile/convex regression and deep learning) and provides an introduction to Explanable Artificial Intelligence (xAI) and Interpretable Machine Learning (IML). Upon completion of the course, students will be able to apply machine learning techniques to support business decision making.
learningOutcomes.en: The course introduces modern methods in predictive modelling (e.g. quantile/convex regression and deep learning) and provides an introduction to Explanable Artificial Intelligence (xAI) and Interpretable Machine Learning (IML). Upon completion of the course, students will be able to apply machine learning techniques to support business decision making.

content.fi:
The content may vary from year to year depending on the lecturers. A more detailed description of the actual content for the implementation will be provided in the course syllabus on MyCourses before registration for the implementation opens.
The examples of topics are:- Advanced regression techniques (quantile/convex regression)- Image recognition using convolutional neural networks (CNN)- Text analysis and NLP using recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and transformers- Introduction to Explainable Artificial Intelligence (xAI) and Interpretable Machine Learning (IML)
The course consists of pre-recorded lecture videos and tutorials in Python for the topics. Python assignments and theory tests will be used to assess student knowledge.
The course is intended for BIZ students. Therefore, in addition to the theoretical foundations, the applications (not the development) of the methods will be presented. Lectures are designed to provide the in-depth material, while the assignments are designed to try out the methods.Knowledge of Python is assumed, but the tutorials are detailed and the assignments are designed considering that coding is a secondary skill.

name.en: Capstone: Data Science for Business II D, Exam

workload.fi: Lectures, tutorials, assignments
workload.sv: Lectures, tutorials, assignments
workload.en: Lectures, tutorials, assignments

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Data Science for Business I; Business Analytics 1 or 2 or equivalent skills. Intermediate / advanced skills in Python or R programming. Intermediate understanding of multivariate calculus is assumed (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Data Science for Business I; Business Analytics 1 or 2 or equivalent skills. Intermediate / advanced skills in Python or R programming. Intermediate understanding of multivariate calculus is assumed (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Data Science for Business I; Business Analytics 1 or 2 or equivalent skills. Intermediate / advanced skills in Python or R programming. Intermediate understanding of multivariate calculus is assumed (e.g. Mathematical tools for analytics).

learningOutcomes.fi: The course introduces modern methods in predictive modelling (e.g. quantile/convex regression and deep learning) and provides an introduction to Explanable Artificial Intelligence (xAI) and Interpretable Machine Learning (IML). Upon completion of the course, students will be able to apply machine learning techniques to support business decision making.
learningOutcomes.sv: The course introduces modern methods in predictive modelling (e.g. quantile/convex regression and deep learning) and provides an introduction to Explanable Artificial Intelligence (xAI) and Interpretable Machine Learning (IML). Upon completion of the course, students will be able to apply machine learning techniques to support business decision making.
learningOutcomes.en: The course introduces modern methods in predictive modelling (e.g. quantile/convex regression and deep learning) and provides an introduction to Explanable Artificial Intelligence (xAI) and Interpretable Machine Learning (IML). Upon completion of the course, students will be able to apply machine learning techniques to support business decision making.

content.fi:
The content may vary from year to year depending on the lecturers. A more detailed description of the actual content for the implementation will be provided in the course syllabus on MyCourses before registration for the implementation opens.
The examples of topics are:- Advanced regression techniques (quantile/convex regression)- Image recognition using convolutional neural networks (CNN)- Text analysis and NLP using recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and transformers- Introduction to Explainable Artificial Intelligence (xAI) and Interpretable Machine Learning (IML)
The course consists of pre-recorded lecture videos and tutorials in Python for the topics. Python assignments and theory tests will be used to assess student knowledge.
The course is intended for BIZ students. Therefore, in addition to the theoretical foundations, the applications (not the development) of the methods will be presented. Lectures are designed to provide the in-depth material, while the assignments are designed to try out the methods.Knowledge of Python is assumed, but the tutorials are detailed and the assignments are designed considering that coding is a secondary skill.

learningOutcomes.fi: After completing the course, the student has basic skills to use ICT in the field of arts in their studies.
learningOutcomes.sv: After completing the course, the student has basic skills to use ICT in the field of arts in their studies.
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, the student has basic skills to use ICT in the field of arts in their studies.

content.fi:
1. Learning the essential use of software that is central to the production of visual communication in the field of arts. Digital image editing, vector graphics, and page layout with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign software.
  2. High-quality visual presentation of one's professional competence.
  3. Legal issues of related materials: usage rights and licenses.
  4. The role of artificial intelligence (AI) within the subject area.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MEC-E7002 Manufacturing Methods I / MEC-E7012 Manufacturing operations MEC-E7003 Manufacturing Methods II / MEC-E1075 Selection of Materials and Manufacturing Processes
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MEC-E7002 Manufacturing Methods I / MEC-E7012 Manufacturing operations MEC-E7003 Manufacturing Methods II / MEC-E1075 Selection of Materials and Manufacturing Processes

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student:
  • is able to perform a project in industrial setting.
  • is able to work in a project team.
  • can prepare a project plan and knows fundamentals of project management.
  • is proficient in applying skills from previous courses.
  • can formulate a practical solution to an industrial problem based on analysis.
  • can write a technical report on project and selected solution.

name.en: Empirical Methods for Market Analysis D, Lecture

workload.en: Lectures and exercise classes

prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Empirical Methods for Economists or Econometrics.

learningOutcomes.en:
This course introduces students to key methods
and models for analyzing data from important markets in the economy. Through
the study of competition, consumer behavior, regulation, and business
evolution, students will develop the skills needed to answer critical questions
in these areas. By the end of the course, students will be well-prepared to
interpret empirical data and communicate their findings effectively in
professional contexts.

content.en:
Amongst the topics covered in the course are
demand estimation and predictions, entry and market structure, pricing and
mergers.

assesmentMethods.en: Assignments and exam

learningOutcomes.fi:
At the end of the course a successful student will be able to:
  • Recognize the evolution path of mobile network standards, with focus from 4G to 5G and beyond.
  • Identify the different target goals of 4G/5G classes of services and recognize the requirements that use cases impose into the development towards 5G and beyond.
  • Be aware of the network architecture and the key technological components of 4G (LTE) and 5G (NR) standards, with emphasis on the radio access network and the key aspects of the core network.
  • Know the tools that can be used for the planning of mobile networks deployments and use them to compute link budget in 4G and 5G cellular systems.
  • Analyze publications from different sources dealing with beyond 5G technologies and develop communication skills (written and oral) to disseminate group project outcomes.

content.fi:
This advanced course on mobile communication systems stars with a clear description of mobile communication networks and its related key technologies. After basics are introduced, contemporary 3GPP standards are covered, with emphasis on 4G (LTE), 4G evolutions (LTE Advanced) and 5G (New Radio). In this part, key aspects of both radio access network and core network parts of the standards are considered. Finally, recent technology developments from the newly developed 5G NR standard beyond terrestrial human-centric communications are approached, including machine-centric communications and non-terrestrial networks, among others. The content of this course is divided into five different units, whose contents are expanded as follows:
  • Unit 1: Introduction. Mobile networks architecture and key concepts. Standardization of mobile systems. Mobile systems evolution. ITU-R activities and IMT vision for contemporary generations. Spectrum for mobile systems. 3GPPP standardization and schedule. Industrial alliances that influence standardization. Use cases and technologies.
  • Unit 2: LTE Radio Access Network and Core Network (4G). LTE requirements and targets. LTE RAN architecture (E-UTRAN). Multiple access and modulation schemes (uplink and downlink). LTE frame numerology, frequency bands and duplexing (FDD and TDD). LTE Radio protocols and channels. LTE Radio Resource Management. LTE Core Network architecture (EPS), entities and interfaces. EPC protocols and procedures. LTE session and mobility management.
  • Unit 3: LTE Advanced and its evolutions (4G+). LTE evolutions targets and requirements. LTE Advanced (Pro) technologies. Carrier aggregation, Coordinated Multipoint (CoMP), and multi-antenna support (MIMO). LTE Advanced small cell enhancements, dual connectivity and proximity services.
  • Unit 4: New Radio (5G). 5G requirements and targets. NR frame numerology, frequency bands and transmission structure (TDD and FDD). Technology components: NR carrier aggregation, Massive MIMO. NR radio protocols and channels. NG-RAN architectures. 5G core network functions and services (NFV/SDN). 5G Core Network protocols and procedures. 5G session and mobility management. Network slicing and multi-access edge computing concepts.
  • Unit 5: Beyond human-centric communications (4G+, 5G and 5G+ verticals). Machine-type communications and Narrow-Band IoT. 5G positioning and sensing. Non-terrestrial networks (space and aerial). Non-public networks (NPN). Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) and concepts of mobile communications for railways (FRMCS). Industrial-IoT (IIoT) for automation. 5G Multicast broadcast. NR for augmented/extended reality (AR/XR).

learningOutcomes.fi:
At the end of the course the student:
  • understands the physics of both intact and damaged ship stability
  • knows how ship stability issues need to be considered in ship design
  • can interpret the background and meaning of ship various stability regulations
  • can apply this knowledge on design and stability analyses of own ship project.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Relevance of previous studies: the candidates should better have a high‐quality bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, Energy Engineering, Automation, Control Engineering, or Physics. Besides, background knowledge in terms of mathematics, programming skills, and control theory is better.

Besides, background knowledge in terms of mathematics, programming skills, and control theory is better.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Relevance of previous studies: the candidates should better have a high‐quality bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, Energy Engineering, Automation, Control Engineering, or Physics. Besides, background knowledge in terms of mathematics, programming skills, and control theory is better.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing this course, the students are able to:
  1. classify and evaluate the technologies in the hydrogen value chain that aim to decarbonize the power and energy sector, industrial processes, and end-users.​  
  2. model and conduct analyses on the functionality and societal impacts of the existing and emerging hydrogen technologies.​ 
  3. analyze and evaluate the role of hydrogen components at different stages of the value chain (production/conversion, transportation, storage, distribution, and utilization) and evaluate their behavior, connection, control, and synergies with the power and energy sector.​  
  4. apply the principles of capturing, storing, and usage of the products and byproducts of hydrogen in the hydrogen value chain.​ 
  5. analyze and develop the components and feasible technical solutions for optimal operation and planning of the power and energy sector.
  6. identify, create, and push forward new business opportunities related to hydrogen technologies. ​ 
  7. manage uncertainties when dealing with challenges in future energy technologies.  
  8. know how to analyze the dynamic and steady-state behavior of the existing and upcoming components.

content.fi:
The basic elements of the hydrogen systems will all be given with a detailed introduction of their operation principle, including:
  1. electrolysers which convert renewables into green hydrogen
  2. tubework and H2 transportation − how to transport hydrogen safely?
  3. H2 storage − how to store hydrogen for later usage?
  4. Compressors − how to compress hydrogen for safe usage?
  5. H2 tubework physics and dynamic phenomena − the basic operation principle of hydrogen transportation.
  6. material questions − the basic materials needed for the hydrogen system.
  7. safety questions – how to guarantee the safety of the hydrogen system during all the processes?
  8. H2 use cases and their influence on H2 tubework: how does the usage of hydrogen affect hydrogen transportation?
  9. integration of the power system and hydrogen system. Demand of flexibility (power/demand balance), sources of flexibility, integrated system dynamics − this section will give a special focus on describing how hydrogen energy will affect the holistic energy systems.

learningOutcomes.fi:
This advanced PhD course aims to help students:
  1. Familiarize themselves with the art as well as conventions behind the crafting of articles for Management Studies’ journals
  2. Comprehend the difference between data and theory, and the range of options for moving between the two
  3. Produce credible and insightful theorizations of their own empirical data
  4. Craft a paper centered around the emerging theorization of their empirical data
  5. Record their process and produce a credible description of their data analysis and theorization methods

content.fi: This course provides a comprehensive learning experience where students get acquainted with various data analysis techniques and develop/extend or test theories, through the resources, assignments and guidance that instructors provide. The learning journey is further enriched by class discussions that promote a cooperative atmosphere for exchanging thoughts and experiences. The assignments and interactions equip students to approach their theoretical constructs and paper drafting with greater preparedness and deliberation, thereby enhancing their confidence and enjoyment in the process.

learningOutcomes.fi:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
  1. Identify, study, compare, evaluate, abstract, and create new knowledge about the use of representation in contemporary digital culture.
  2. Propose and create novel implementations and uses of representation in new media.
  3. Generate new research hypotheses and works in areas related to representation and new media.

  3. Generate new research hypotheses and works in areas related to representation and new media.
learningOutcomes.en:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
  1. Identify, study, compare, evaluate, abstract, and create new knowledge about the use of representation in contemporary digital culture.
  2. Propose and create novel implementations and uses of representation in new media.
  3. Generate new research hypotheses and works in areas related to representation and new media.

content.fi:
Representation, which has been defined as the use of signs to stand for something else, can be described as a ubiquitous tool in the artist and designer's toolbox.
  1. There are several reasons why the notion of representation is important to artists and designers:
  2. It is a phenomenon that emerges from our embodied experience in the world as humans and brings together language, culture and sensory perception.
  3. The internalized affects, knowledge, and values of human communities are externalized and made concrete into artefacts of culture through the use of representation. It is by understanding how diverse forms of representation are used in the making of genres for example, that we can assimilate the universe created in a work of interactive narrative.
  4. Representation plays an important role in the way that human beings understand and express the ethos (character and spirit) of the society in which they live.
  5. Because the computer is regarded as the machine that can (re)present all other media, it is important that students working with new media learn about all aspects related representation from an artistic as well as technical perspective.
The course offers the students a holistic systems-oriented approach to the topic of representation. Rather than a mimetic approach, a systems-oriented, research-based approach into the notion of representation leads the art and design scholar to discern and evaluate the context and reasons why an artist or a designer might have chosen a particular set of tools, or decided on a particular theme, topic, or strategy for the realization a given work.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Ei vaadittavia esitietojaSuositellut esitiedot: Yleistä materiaalien fysikaalisista, mekaanisista ja kemiallisista ominaisuuksista
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: Inga förkunskaper krävsRekommenderade förkunskaper: Allmän kunskap om materials fysikaliska, mekaniska och kemiska egenskaper
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: No prerequisites requiredRecommended prerequisites: General knowledge of physical, mechanical and chemical properties of materials

learningOutcomes.fi:
Opintojaksolla perehdytään tärkeimpiin talo- ja infrarakentamisessa käytettäviin rakennusmateriaaleihin, niiden tärkeimmät ominaisuudet, soveltuvuuden erilaisiin käyttökohteisiin sekä materiaalien ympäristövaikutukset.

Opiskelija tuntee materiaalitekniikan peruskäsitteet kuuluvien rakennusmateriaalien raakaaineet ja valmistusmenetelmät, koostumuksen ja ominaisuudet suunnittelun, rakennustyön, käytön ja säilyvyyden kannalta.
learningOutcomes.sv:
I slutet av kursen ska de studerande ha:
- lärt sig grundläggande sammansättningar, egenskaper och tillämpningar av vanliga byggmaterial
- förstått hur tillverkningsprocesser påverkar byggmaterialens egenskaper och kännetecken
- förmåga att tillämpa den inhämtade kunskapen för att utföra materialprovning och prestandautvärdering för byggmaterial
learningOutcomes.en:
At the end of the course the students should have:
- learnt the basic composition, properties and applications of common building materials
- understood how manufacturing processes affect the properties and the characteristics of building materials
- prepared to apply the gained knowledge to perform materials testing and performance evaluation for building materials

content.fi:
Tämä kurssi tarjoaa johdannon yleisimpiin rakennusmateriaaleihin, ominaisuuksiin ja niiden sovelluksiin. Kurssi sisältää seuraavat aiheet:
1: Rakennusmateriaalien perusominaisuudet
2: Tiilen ja muuraustyöt
3: Kiviainekset, sementtipohjaiset materiaalit, betoni ja raudoitukset
4: Rakennuspuutavara
5: Bitumiset materiaalit
6: Keskeisten rakennusmateriaalien turmeltuminen
7: Rakennusmateriaalien turmituminen ja kestävä käyttö
content.sv:
Denna kurs ger en introduktion till grunderna för vanliga byggmaterial, egenskaper och deras tillämpningar. Kursen innehåller följande ämnen:
1: Byggmaterials grundläggande egenskaper
2: Murarbeten
3: Stenmaterial, cementbaserade material, betong och armeringsmaterial
4: Byggvirke
5: Bituminösa material
6: Försämring av byggmaterial
7: Hållbar användning av byggmaterial
content.en:
This course offers an introduction to the basic of common building materials, properties and their applications. The course include the following topics:
1: Fundamental properties of building materials
2: Masonry work
3: Aggregates, cementitious materials, concrete and reinforcement materials
4: Construction timber
5: Bituminous materials
6: Deterioration of building materials
7: Sustainable use of building materials

assesmentMethods.fi:
Opintojaksolla käytetään numeerista arviointiasteikkoa (1-5). Kurssi sisältää seuraavat oppimismenetelmät ja -toiminnot:
  • Luennot
  • Viikoittaiset tehtävät (30%)
  • Laboratoriotestien esittely(10%)
  • Loppukoe kurssin lopussa (60%)
Kurssin arvosana: (Loppukoe 60%) + (Viikkotehtävät ja laboratorio 40%)
assesmentMethods.sv:
Kursen använder en numerisk utvärderingsskala (1-5).
Kursen innehåller följande inlärningsmetoder och aktiviteter:
- Föreläsningar
- Veckouppgifter (30%)
- Laboratorietest demonstration (10%)
- Sluttentamen i slutet av kursen (60%)
Kursens betyg: (Sluttentamen 60%) + (Veckouppgifter och laboratorium 40%)
assesmentMethods.en:
The course uses a numerical evaluation scale (1-5).
The course includes the following learning methods and activities:
- Lectures
- Weekly assignments (30%)
- Laboratory testing demonstration (10%)
- Final exam at the end of the course (60%)
The course grading: (Final exam 60%) +  (Weekly assignments and laboratory 40%)

Opiskelija tuntee materiaalitekniikan peruskäsitteet kuuluvien rakennusmateriaalien raakaaineet ja valmistusmenetelmät, koostumuksen ja ominaisuudet suunnittelun, rakennustyön, käytön ja säilyvyyden kannalta.
learningOutcomes.sv:
I slutet av kursen ska de studerande ha:
- lärt sig grundläggande sammansättningar, egenskaper och tillämpningar av vanliga byggmaterial
- förstått hur tillverkningsprocesser påverkar byggmaterialens egenskaper och kännetecken
- förmåga att tillämpa den inhämtade kunskapen för att utföra materialprovning och prestandautvärdering för byggmaterial
learningOutcomes.en:
At the end of the course the students should have:
- learnt the basic composition, properties and applications of common building materials
- understood how manufacturing processes affect the properties and the characteristics of building materials
- prepared to apply the gained knowledge to perform materials testing and performance evaluation for building materials

content.fi:
Tämä kurssi tarjoaa johdannon yleisimpiin rakennusmateriaaleihin, ominaisuuksiin ja niiden sovelluksiin. Kurssi sisältää seuraavat aiheet:
1: Rakennusmateriaalien perusominaisuudet
2: Tiilen ja muuraustyöt
3: Kiviainekset, sementtipohjaiset materiaalit, betoni ja raudoitukset
4: Rakennuspuutavara
5: Bitumiset materiaalit
6: Keskeisten rakennusmateriaalien turmeltuminen
7: Rakennusmateriaalien turmituminen ja kestävä käyttö
content.sv:
Denna kurs ger en introduktion till grunderna för vanliga byggmaterial, egenskaper och deras tillämpningar. Kursen innehåller följande ämnen:
1: Byggmaterials grundläggande egenskaper
2: Murarbeten
3: Stenmaterial, cementbaserade material, betong och armeringsmaterial
4: Byggvirke
5: Bituminösa material
6: Försämring av byggmaterial
7: Hållbar användning av byggmaterial
content.en:
This course offers an introduction to the basic of common building materials, properties and their applications. The course include the following topics:
1: Fundamental properties of building materials
2: Masonry work
3: Aggregates, cementitious materials, concrete and reinforcement materials
4: Construction timber
5: Bituminous materials
6: Deterioration of building materials
7: Sustainable use of building materials

assesmentMethods.fi:
Opintojaksolla käytetään numeerista arviointiasteikkoa (1-5). Kurssi sisältää seuraavat oppimismenetelmät ja -toiminnot:
  • Luennot
  • Viikoittaiset tehtävät (30%)
  • Laboratoriotestien esittely(10%)
  • Loppukoe kurssin lopussa (60%)
Kurssin arvosana: (Loppukoe 60%) + (Viikkotehtävät ja laboratorio 40%)
assesmentMethods.sv:
Kursen använder en numerisk utvärderingsskala (1-5).
Kursen innehåller följande inlärningsmetoder och aktiviteter:
- Föreläsningar
- Veckouppgifter (30%)
- Laboratorietest demonstration (10%)
- Sluttentamen i slutet av kursen (60%)
Kursens betyg: (Sluttentamen 60%) + (Veckouppgifter och laboratorium 40%)
assesmentMethods.en:
The course uses a numerical evaluation scale (1-5).
The course includes the following learning methods and activities:
- Lectures
- Weekly assignments (30%)
- Laboratory testing demonstration (10%)
- Final exam at the end of the course (60%)
The course grading: (Final exam 60%) +  (Weekly assignments and laboratory 40%)

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
  • tunnistaa suunnittelutilanteen edellyttämiä analyysitarpeita
  • osaa jäsentää suunnittelutehtävää ja kehittää päättelytaitojaan analyysityön avulla
  • tunnistaa suunnittelun kompleksisen ja synteettisen luonteen
  • tunnistaa yhdyskuntasuunnittelun yhteiskunnallisia näkökulmia, ammatillisia toimintaympäristöjä ja intressiryhmiä
  • ymmärtää laajan ja monialaisen työn hallinnan ja koordinoinnin haasteita
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter avlagd kurs kan den studerande
  • känna igen vilka analyser som bör genomföras under planeringen
  • klara av att strukturera planeringsuppgiften och utvecklar sin slutledningsförmåga med hjälp av analysarbetet
  • känne till planeringens komplexa och syntetiska natur
  • känna till samhälleliga aspekter samt det professionella kontextet och intressegrupper inom samhällsplaneringen
  • förstå de utmaningar som uppkommer under ledandet och koordinerandet av omfattande och branschöverskirdanade arbete
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course a student
  • identifies analytical needs of the planning case at hand
  • learns to structure planning cases, and improve analytical thinking via analysis
  • learns to recognise complex and synthetic nature of urban planning
  • identifies stakeholders/interest groups, professional context as well as societal viewpoints of urban planning
  • understands management tasks of vast and multidisciplinary project

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
  • is able to apply thermophysical and transport properties in design of separation processes
  • is able to apply phase equilibrium models for separation cases
  • is capable to understand the role of mass transfer for real processes
  • is capable to apply process simulators in solving simple industrial examples

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the 3 cr. version of the course, the student
  • understands the purpose, basic properties, and use of derivatives for financial risk managment,
  • knows the mathematical theory of options and other derivatives, 
  • is familiar with how models are implemented, how they are used in practice, and what the strengths and weaknesses of different models are.
  • knows how to use tools from engineering mathematics and physics in financial risk management and finance, and what are their limitations.
Additionally, after the 5 cr. version of the course, the student knows how to apply engineering mathematics and computational methods to the analysis of financal market data.

registration.fi: paikoille ilmoittautuminen: Avoimen yliopiston järjestämään koulutukseen ilmoittaudutaan ”avoimen yliopiston tarjonta” välilehdellä myynnissä olevan opetuksen kautta. Lue ensin kurssin kuvaus Avoimen sivuilta:

content.fi: Kurssi perehdyttää sinut liike-elämän ammattilaisten keskeisiin  taitoihin: viestintään, vuorovaikutukseen, luovuuden edistämiseen,  esiintymistaitoon ja neuvottelutaitoon. Keskitymme erityisesti  rakentavan ja kaksisuuntaisen vuorovaikutuksen lähtökohtiin. Erilaisten harjoitusten ja teorian kautta opit tapoja viestiä  onnistuneesti ja rakentavasti eri tilanteissa sekä johtajana,  asiantuntijana että tiimin jäsenenä. Lisäksi harjoitukset kehittävät  niin luovuuttasi kuin konkreettisia tiimityötaitojasi kuten kuuntelua,  arvostusta ja toisten ideoiden laajentamista yhteisten tavoitteiden  saavuttamiseksi.

workload.en: Lectures, exercises, and exam

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin myötä opiskelija:
  1. Osaa kriittisesti arvioida tuotannon ja liiketoiminnan kestävyyttä sekä suunnitella strategioita, joilla pyritään kehittämään organisaatioita ja niiden prosesseja kohti ympäristövaikutusten vähentämistä ja sosiaalista vastuunkantoa. 
  2. Pystyy selittämään liiketoiminnan osa-alueiden sekä johtamisen merkitystä ja keskeisiä yhtymäkohtia kestävään kehitykseen.
  3. Ymmärtää kestävän talouden kokonaiskuvaa ja tulevaisuusskenaarioita, ja osaa kuvata lainsäädännön ja innovaatioiden merkitystä kestävyyden edistämisessä.
  4. Jäsentää omaa rooliaan kestävän kehityksen tavoitteiden edistäjänä ja monimutkaisten yhteiskunnallisten ongelmien ratkaisijana yhdessä muiden toimijoiden kanssa.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen kommer studenten att kunna:
  1. Kritiskt bedöma hållbarheten inom produktion och affärsverksamhet samt utforma strategier för att utveckla organisationer och deras processer mot minskade miljöpåverkningar och ökat socialt ansvarstagande.
  2. Förklara betydelsen och centrala kopplingar mellan olika affärsområden och ledning i relation till hållbar utveckling.
  3. Förstå helhetsbilden av hållbar ekonomi och framtida scenarier samt kunna beskriva lagstiftningens och innovationernas betydelse för främjande av hållbarhet.
  4. Analysera sin egen roll som främjare av hållbarhetsmål och lösare av komplexa samhällsproblem i samarbete med andra aktörer.
learningOutcomes.en:
As a result of the course, the student will be able to:
  1. Critically assess the sustainability of production and business and design strategies aimed at developing organizations and their processes towards reducing environmental impacts and taking social responsibility.
  2. Explain the significance and key intersections of business areas and management in relation to sustainable development.
  3. Understand the big picture of sustainable economy and future scenarios, and be able to describe the significance of legislation and innovations in promoting sustainability.
  4. Analyze their own role as a promoter of sustainable development goals and as a solver of complex societal problems, working together with other stakeholders.

content.fi:
Kestävä kehitys sisältyy kokonaisvaltaisesti liiketoiminnan eri osa-alueisiin. Kestävyysajattelu, -vaatimukset ja lainsäädäntö eivät ainoastaan luo uusia liiketoiminnan mahdollisuuksia. Ne edellyttävät merkittävää sopeutumista myös nykyiseltä liiketoiminnalta, järjestelmiltä, johtamiselta ja organisoitumiselta – kulutuksesta puhumattakaan. Kurssin lähtökohtana on, että yrityksillä ja muilla organisaatioilla on keskeinen yhteiskunnallinen rooli kestävän muutoksen ajureina.
Kurssi tarjoaa opiskelijoille kokonaisymmärryksen ja perustan kestävän liiketoiminnan periaatteista ja käytännöistä. Se antaa opiskelijoille valmiuksia analysoida ja suunnitella kestäviä periaatteita noudattavia ratkaisuja. Kurssi luo vahvat perusteet kestävän liiketoiminnan johtamiselle, korostaen ekologisesti ja sosiaalisesti kestävää kehitystä liiketoiminnan eri osa-alueilla.
Kurssilla käsitellään muun muassa seuraavia kysymyksiä: Mitä tarkoittavat kestävästi toimiva talous ja liiketoiminta, ja miten niitä ohjataan? Miten kestävyys ilmenee organisaatioiden eri osa-alueilla, kuten tuotantoprosesseissa, investoinneissa, johtamisessa ja strategiatyössä? Kuinka kiertotalous, kestävä palvelutalous ja innovaatiot vaikuttavat kestävän liiketoiminnan edistämiseen?
content.sv:
Hållbar utveckling inkluderas heltäckande i olika delar av verksamheten. Hållbarhetstänkande, -krav och lagstiftning skapar inte bara nya affärsmöjligheter. De kräver också betydande anpassning från befintlig verksamhet, system, ledning och organisering - inte minst när det gäller konsumtion. Utgångspunkten för kursen är att företag och andra organisationer har en central samhällelig roll som drivkrafter för hållbar förändring.
Kursen ger studenterna en övergripande förståelse och grund för principer och metoder för hållbart företagande. Den ger studenterna färdigheter att analysera och planera lösningar som följer hållbara principer. Kursen skapar starka grunder för ledning av hållbart företagande, med tonvikt på ekologisk och social hållbarhet inom olika affärsområden.
Kursen behandlar bland annat följande frågor: Vad innebär hållbar ekonomi och företagande, och hur styrs de? Hur manifesteras hållbarhet inom olika områden av organisationer, såsom produktionsprocesser, investeringar, ledning och strategiarbete? Hur påverkar cirkulär ekonomi, hållbar tjänsteekonomi och innovationer främjandet av hållbart företagande?
content.en:
Sustainable development is comprehensively integrated into various aspects of business. Sustainability thinking, requirements, and legislation not only create new business opportunities but also require significant adaptation from existing business, systems, management, and organization – not to mention consumption. The starting point of the course is that companies and other organizations play a crucial societal role as drivers of sustainable change.
The course provides students with a comprehensive understanding and foundation of the principles and practices of sustainable business. It equips students with the ability to analyze and plan solutions that adhere to sustainable principles. The course establishes a strong foundation for sustainable business management, emphasizing ecological and social sustainability across various business areas.
The course addresses questions such as: What does a sustainably functioning economy and business mean, and how are they guided? How does sustainability manifest itself in different areas of organizations, such as production processes, investments, management, and strategic work? How do circular economy, sustainable service economy, and innovations contribute to the promotion of sustainable business?

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course the student will be able understand and develop power electronic solutions from materials’ compatibility viewpoint. Special emphasis is placed on multimaterial structures utilized in novel semiconductor components and interconnections. The student will gain knowledge on traditional and new materials and manufacturing processes for power electronic products including semiconductor chips, substrates and PCBs, component and module level packaging and integration solutions, and electromechanics. Moreover, the student will become acquainted with the most common thermal and thermo-mechanical modeling and simulation tools and microstructural characterization methods in order to utilize them in reliability assessment including accelerated reliability testing, failure analyses and life-time estimation procedures. After the course the student is also familiar with the legislation on circular economy and e-waste and their impact on design and reliability aspects in power electronics.

content.fi:
The main topics to be covered are:
Wide-bandgap semiconductors
- Materials and applications
- Front-end and back-end manufacturing processes
Power components and modules
- First level interconnections
- Lead frames and substrates
- Molding and encapsulation materials and processes
Reliability and robustness
- Thermal and thermomechanical desing
- Reliability testing, characterization and failure analyses
- Life-time estimation
High voltage dielectrics
Novel manufacturing methods
- Additive manufacturing/ 3D printing
Ecodesign basics for power converters and electrical machines

learningOutcomes.fi:
- Understanding the concepts of sustainable business and corporate responsibility
- Understanding the central tensions in corporate sustainability
- Identifying sustainability challenges and introducing strategic approaches to respond to them
- Understanding sustainability in different business functions and the management instruments available;
- Developing critical thinking about how to deal with different stakeholders in advancing sustainability;
- Recognizing how enterprises can innovate to develop more sustainable businesses.

literature.en: A selection of articles. Required pre-readings for each lecture (1-3 articles per lecture).
literature.fi: A selection of articles. Required pre-readings for each lecture (1-3 articles per lecture).

content.fi: This course focuses on the role of business in addressing the vast sustainable development challenges faced by the world.  There is a complex relationship between business and sustainability, as business has historically been the source of many of these challenges (e.g. climate change, inequality, pollution), and yet business must also be part of the solution, given the size and scope of global business activities.  Against this backdrop, there has been an undeniable shift in business attitudes towards sustainability, with corporations increasingly wanting to act sustainably. However, these companies are constrained by the competitive pressures that speak to the core of the sustainability challenge: on the one hand, a more sustainable company does good for the world, but on the other hand if done incorrectly, sustainability shifts undercut the financial viability of a company. Put another way, even the world s most sustainable company does no good if it goes out of business. With this in mind, the focus of this course is first on understanding the nature of this tension, and second on understanding how to develop business strategies that are simultaneously better for the environment, society, and a company s finances. To truly pursue the needed sustainability shift, companies must creatively address the needs of their diverse stakeholders so that they can find win-wins. Overall, the course will cover expansive ground, including business strategy, supply chains, sustainability management and communication instruments, innovation for sustainability, and the circular economy. Simulations and cases will be used to highlight the underlying complexity.

workload.fi: 16 hours of contact teaching in a (flipped classroom) lecture format, 8 hours of self-study for the pre-recorded materials and example programs, 24 hours of contact teaching in coding sessions (6 sessions for tutorials on the example codes and supercomputer environment usage, 6 sessions for Q&A coding sessions for solving the exercises); 87 hours for independent work to solve the coding exercises.

prerequisites.fi: Good understanding of computer programming, algorithms and data structures is necessary. Basic programming skills with C are required, which is used in the assignments. Knowledge of Unix, shell scripting, and/or supercomputer architectures is a bonus.

learningOutcomes.fi: The topic of this course is high-performance computing (HPC), namely heavy-duty computing on clusters or supercomputers with thousand(s) to million(s) of cores. You will learn about the main HPC architectures (tightly versus loosely coupled architectures), distributed memory and hybrid (distributed + shared memory) programming models, message-passing interface, threading, and massive parallelism with graphics processing units (GPUs).
learningOutcomes.sv: The topic of this course is high-performance computing (HPC), namely heavy-duty computing on clusters or supercomputers with thousand(s) to million(s) of cores. You will learn about the main HPC architectures (tightly versus loosely coupled architectures), distributed memory and hybrid (distributed + shared memory) programming models, message-passing interface, threading, and massive parallelism with graphics processing units (GPUs).
learningOutcomes.en: The topic of this course is high-performance computing (HPC), namely heavy-duty computing on clusters or supercomputers with thousand(s) to million(s) of cores. You will learn about the main HPC architectures (tightly versus loosely coupled architectures), distributed memory and hybrid (distributed + shared memory) programming models, message-passing interface, threading, and massive parallelism with graphics processing units (GPUs).

content.fi: Introduction to the current HPC landscape and supercomputing architectures; Introduction/Recap to different parallel programming models and parallel program design; Deeper dive into theory and practise of distributed memory and hybrid computing models; Message passing interface, from basics to advanced topics; Hybrid computing with MPI + openMP; Hybrid computing with GPUs with MPI + CUDA; Parallel I/O.
content.sv: Introduction to the current HPC landscape and supercomputing architectures; Introduction/Recap to different parallel programming models and parallel program design; Deeper dive into theory and practise of distributed memory and hybrid computing models; Message passing interface, from basics to advanced topics; Hybrid computing with MPI + openMP; Hybrid computing with GPUs with MPI + CUDA; Parallel I/O.

prerequisites.fi: Good understanding of computer programming, algorithms and data structures is necessary. Basic programming skills with C are required, which is used in the assignments. Knowledge of Unix, shell scripting, and/or supercomputer architectures is a bonus.
prerequisites.sv: Good understanding of computer programming, algorithms and data structures is necessary. Basic programming skills with C are required, which is used in the assignments. Knowledge of Unix, shell scripting, and/or supercomputer architectures is a bonus.
prerequisites.en: Good understanding of computer programming, algorithms and data structures is necessary. Basic programming skills with C are required, which is used in the assignments. Knowledge of Unix, shell scripting, and/or supercomputer architectures is a bonus.

learningOutcomes.fi: The topic of this course is high-performance computing (HPC), namely heavy-duty computing on clusters or supercomputers with thousand(s) to million(s) of cores. You will learn about the main HPC architectures (tightly versus loosely coupled architectures), distributed memory and hybrid (distributed + shared memory) programming models, message-passing interface, threading, and massive parallelism with graphics processing units (GPUs).
learningOutcomes.sv: The topic of this course is high-performance computing (HPC), namely heavy-duty computing on clusters or supercomputers with thousand(s) to million(s) of cores. You will learn about the main HPC architectures (tightly versus loosely coupled architectures), distributed memory and hybrid (distributed + shared memory) programming models, message-passing interface, threading, and massive parallelism with graphics processing units (GPUs).
learningOutcomes.en: The topic of this course is high-performance computing (HPC), namely heavy-duty computing on clusters or supercomputers with thousand(s) to million(s) of cores. You will learn about the main HPC architectures (tightly versus loosely coupled architectures), distributed memory and hybrid (distributed + shared memory) programming models, message-passing interface, threading, and massive parallelism with graphics processing units (GPUs).

content.fi: Introduction to the current HPC landscape and supercomputing architectures; Introduction/Recap to different parallel programming models and parallel program design; Deeper dive into theory and practise of distributed memory and hybrid computing models; Message passing interface, from basics to advanced topics; Hybrid computing with MPI + openMP; Hybrid computing with GPUs with MPI + CUDA; Parallel I/O.
content.sv: Introduction to the current HPC landscape and supercomputing architectures; Introduction/Recap to different parallel programming models and parallel program design; Deeper dive into theory and practise of distributed memory and hybrid computing models; Message passing interface, from basics to advanced topics; Hybrid computing with MPI + openMP; Hybrid computing with GPUs with MPI + CUDA; Parallel I/O.
content.en: Introduction to the current HPC landscape and supercomputing architectures; Introduction/Recap to different parallel programming models and parallel program design; Deeper dive into theory and practise of distributed memory and hybrid computing models; Message passing interface, from basics to advanced topics; Hybrid computing with MPI + openMP; Hybrid computing with GPUs with MPI + CUDA; Parallel I/O.

assesmentMethods.fi: Assessment is based on the returned exercise codes, materials, attendance and exam. Coding exercises are graded in a supercomputing environment.

prerequisites.fi: Basics in mathematics, statistics, computer science and programming.

learningOutcomes.fi: The course provides you with basic understanding of high-throughput data and computational methods that are commonly used for analysing the data in biological and biomedical problems. After the course you have skills to apply various computational methods in real biological problems and study the field further.
learningOutcomes.sv: The course provides you with basic understanding of high-throughput data and computational methods that are commonly used for analysing the data in biological and biomedical problems. After the course you have skills to apply various computational methods in real biological problems and study the field further.
learningOutcomes.en: The course provides you with basic understanding of high-throughput data and computational methods that are commonly used for analysing the data in biological and biomedical problems. After the course you have skills to apply various computational methods in real biological problems and study the field further.

content.fi: The course introduces computational and statistical methods for analyzing modern high-throughput biological data and their use in systems biology. The course covers microarray, high-throughput sequencing (HTS), single-cell and mass-spectrometry technologies and computational methods for HTS data alignment, genotyping, gene expression analysis, chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing, epigenetics and proteomics. Relevant high-throughput measurement technologies are reviewed during the course.
content.sv: The course introduces computational and statistical methods for analyzing modern high-throughput biological data and their use in systems biology. The course covers microarray, high-throughput sequencing (HTS), single-cell and mass-spectrometry technologies and computational methods for HTS data alignment, genotyping, gene expression analysis, chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing, epigenetics and proteomics. Relevant high-throughput measurement technologies are reviewed during the course.
